message_1: Suppose A = {1, 3, 5} and B = {2, 4, 6}. Find the intersection and union of sets A and B.
message_2:
The intersection of two sets A and B, denoted by A ∩ B, is the set of all elements that are common to both A and B. In this case, there are no common elements between sets A and B, so the intersection is an empty set:

A ∩ B = ∅

The union of two sets A and B, denoted by A ∪ B, is the set of all elements that belong to either A or B or both. In this case, the union of sets A and B is:

A ∪ B = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}
